name: destabilizing
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
making a government, area, or political group lose power or control, or making a political or economic situation less strong or safe, by causing changes and problems: destabilizing effect The conflict had a seriously destabilizing effect on the region. At first, the trade deal seemed more destabilizing than beneficial. See
destabilize
More examplesFewer examplesOrganized crime is another major destabilizing influence.Development of nuclear weapons is a dangerous and potentially destabilizing development for the world. He was a destabilizing force in the country for quite some time.
